alston.minecraft

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Inventory

    public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains all the basic functions of any pop-up window, including interactions with the mouse such as Item manipulation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Window()
      Creates a new Window; this should never be called directly, but through a super() call from a class that extends this; Note: setup() MUST be called before using the Window).

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the inventory on the GUI.

      • rightClick

        public void rightClick()
        The user right clicks. Does nothing unless the user is currently left-clicking an Item, in which case it would split the clicked Item into 2 stacks, with one only containing 1 if they right clicked on an empty slot, or adding to it if it's the same type. If the user attempts to right click an occupied slot that the Item occupying it is not of same type, does nothing.

      • release

        public void release()
        User released on the inventory menu.

      • getInventoryItemsNode

        The Node containing only the Items of the Inventory
